original_title: Korean arrested in Sri Lanka over attempts to send locals to foreign jobs sans valid license
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT- A Korean citizen from Sri Lanka’s capital Colombo district who is alleged to have taken money to send  people to Korean jobs without a valid license was arrested by the Investigation Division of Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE), officials said.

“We received three complaints from the people who were tricked by this Korean individual who has taken 500,000 (Sri Lankan) rupees from those people,” an official from the Investigation Division of SLBFE told Economy Next.
The official had no information whether the arrested Korean had sent anyone to Korea for employment as the complaints were only over taking money from the people.
“He will be produced before the magistrate court also and everything will be done according to the court procedures,” the official said.
The Korean citizen is expected to be charged and asked to return the money that he took from those people. (Colombo/May 26/2023)
